pages.text: It is time for the $(ml:goo/hastur#finale)Final Act of the Play$(). With this rite, one may bring a fragment of Carcosa to the Wake, creating a Simulacrum of the King and his Sphere. This image of Carcosa will greatly benefit those affiliated with the King, as well as reduce those not to driveling madness.
It will convert the biome around the ritual area, so be sure to cast it correctly...

This rite has an extensive list of requirements. It needs $(li)at least three $(ml:bestiary/serfs)Yellow Serfs$()$(li)one $(ml:bestiary/prince)Tattered Prince$()$(li)sufficient distance from other active Simulacra$(li)a proper $(marked)ritual structure$().$(br)The ritual structure consists of four pillars around the Octagram and must be maintained at all times.
Note that any Hastur-aligned mural or statue may be used, as well as a variety of materials for the base blocks.

After a brief opening period, the rite will invite its caster to step in. Doing so will start a $(t:You'll have to solve a 4x4 Sudoku)$(o)most challenging challenge to the mind$().$(br2)During this challenge, you will be left completely exposed to saboteurs (which are bound to appear!), which is why we recommend to take several precautions.

Once the challenge is complete, this rite will $(marked)stay active$(), maintaining the Simulacrum. Destroying the Octagram or any of its surrounding pillars will force the Simulacrum into an inactive state, enabling outsiders to remove it.$(br2)To $(marked)reactivate$() the Simulacrum, simply cast this rite within it.
